text: Marietta Omarovna Chudakova (; 2 January 1937 â€“ 21 November 2021) was a Soviet and Russian literary critic, historian, and doctor of philological sciences, writer, memoirist, public figure. She was the chairman of the All-Russian Bulgakov Foundation. She was a known critic of Vladimir Putin. Chudakova worked at Moscow State University. Her first works were published in 1958. From 1959 to 1961, she taught Russian language and literature in a Moscow school. She was the chairman of the All-Russian Bulgakov Foundation. She was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1991. Chudakova was diagnosed with COVID-19 in early November 2021.
